I came here twice in one week.  The food the first time around was that good that I wanted to share the experience with my special someone.  I had the panang curry on my first visit.  It was beautifully presented in a 1/2 coconut husk/shell.  It was so full of flavor and it didn't disappoint.  I have to agree, the place is a little high on the prices and makes the wallet much lighter after 2 visits in one week, but it's been worth it so far.  I don't intend on eating there till I'm broke, but I'll be back.  The second time I went I had the Tuna wasabi burger. Wasn't as impressive as the curry, but apparently it wasn't on the weekend brunch menu. insert sad face.  I saw several salmon and quinoa dishes passing my table during lunch.  It looked delicious!  If my panang isn't on the menu on my next visit, I might give that one a try.
